quest.name: An Ode to Unity
journal: Ehll Tou is eager to share her newest labor of love with her own kind.
objectives: Search for Ehll Tou at Zenith.
Deliver Ehll Tou's hammer to the endearing dragonet.
Speak with Ehll Tou at Saint Roelle's Dais.

dialogue.name: EHLLTOU
dialogue.text: At last, my culinary masterwork is ready to be shared with my kin. Thanks to the guidance of my capable teachers, I believe I've cooked up something that will have even the most stubborn among them clamoring for more!

dialogue.name: EHLLTOU
dialogue.text: Doubtless even now they are eagerly awaiting my arrival, their whispers of what I might bring filling the Churning Mists with expectation. I'd best leave at once─there are few things more unpleasant than a hungry dragon!

dialogue.name: HAUTDLONG
dialogue.text: Safe travels, Ehll Tou!

dialogue.name: EHLLTOU
dialogue.text: Ack... So dizzy. Wings...aching... No, I must move forward! Before the food cools and with it...the esteem of my kin...

dialogue.name: HAUTDLONG
dialogue.text: Ehll Tou? Is something the matter?

dialogue.name: EHLLTOU
dialogue.text: N-Not at all! In fact, I'm positively...effervescent! Now wait right here. I'll be back before you've even realized I've gone!

dialogue.name: HAUTDLONG
dialogue.text: Hmm... It shouldn't have taken this long...

dialogue.name: HAUTDLONG
dialogue.text: Come to think of it, Ehll Tou was acting rather strangely before she departed...

dialogue.name: HAUTDLONG
dialogue.text: Perhaps we should ask Master Arvide for counsel. He seems to have a solution for every problem. Oh, I hope nothing untoward has happened...

dialogue.name: HAUTDLONG
dialogue.text: I'll stay here and keep watch for Ehll Tou. I pray you and Master Arvide can get to the bottom of this!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Custom deliveries cannot be made while this quest is in progress. They will become available again once the quest is completed.

dialogue.name: HAUTDLONG
dialogue.text: Would that there was something I could do but stand here...

dialogue.name: ARVIDE
dialogue.text: Good eveningmorningday! What brings you here?

dialogue.name: ARVIDE
dialogue.text: ...Now that you mention it, I haven't seen Ehll Tou since she left with her delivery. You're certain she hasn't returned?

dialogue.name: ARVIDE
dialogue.text: I meant to give her this hammer I made as a little reward for her efforts. Considering how hard she's been working, I wouldn't be surprised if she's just gone for a leisurely stroll─or a fly, I suppose? A flit?

dialogue.name: ARVIDE
dialogue.text: Anyroad, she is a dragon, albeit a tiny one. Try as we might, we would be fools to think we understand even a fraction of what goes on in her head. I'm sure she'll return in her own time.

dialogue.name: ARVIDE
dialogue.text: Still, if you must go looking for her, take the hammer. I've no doubt her eagerness to learn how to use it would send her back here as fast as her little wings can carry her.

dialogue.name: ARVIDE
dialogue.text: She often goes on at length about her dragonet friends at this place called Zenith, somewhere in the Churning Mists. If that rings a bell to you, I reckon it might be a good place to start.

dialogue.name: ARVIDE
dialogue.text: I don't know much about the Churning Mists aside from that I'm liable to get eaten whole before I've walked a yalm. I'm certain you'll manage to go a bit further than that, eh?

dialogue.name: DRAGONET03890
dialogue.text: Oh, is that who I think it is? The very hero who triumphed over Nidhogg and brought peace between our kinds? From all the stories Ehll Tou has told of you, I expected a bit more...grandeur.

dialogue.name: DRAGONET03890
dialogue.text: I suppose appearances come second when you spend your days working with your claws. Or hands, were they? Nevertheless, I must thank you for taking the time to pass down such refined arts to my friend. We do so enjoy seeing what she brings!

dialogue.name: DRAGONET03890
dialogue.text: You're looking for her? She's visiting friends not far from here, gushing over that─what was it?─“cooking” of hers. Delectable stuff, that. To think there was more to food than scorching and chomping.

dialogue.name: DRAGONET03890
dialogue.text: Considering the distance you've traveled, I'm terribly sorry to say that she specifically requested not to let anyone from the surface see her until she was ready. She was quite insistent, in fact.

dialogue.name: DRAGONET03890
dialogue.text: Still, I'm sure she would be delighted to receive that deadly looking trinket of yours. What did you call it? A “hammer”? It looks far too heavy for me to wield myself, but I should be able to carry it without dropping it. That is, unless I choose to drop it. Those moogles who've been pestering me are in need of some long overdue comeuppance...

dialogue.name: DRAGONET03890
dialogue.text: Ahem! Anyway, I shall let her know you've arrived, but let me warn you that it may be some time until she is willing to show herself.

dialogue.name: DRAGONET03890
dialogue.text: Now pass that hammer of yours over here. I pray it is not as unwieldy as it looks.

dialogue.name: DRAGONET03890
dialogue.text: Hmm... So this is one of those “tools” you wingless ones are so fond of? Are all of them as complex as this one? It shall be safe in my keeping, I assure you. I wouldn't have the slightest idea how to use it even if I wanted.

dialogue.name: DRAGONET03890
dialogue.text: Now wait here, and I shall return. When, however, I cannot say...

dialogue.name: HAUTDLONG
dialogue.text: MissSir Surname, there you are!

dialogue.name: ARVIDE
dialogue.text: Surprised to see us, I take it. Young Hautdilong got it in his head to come searching for Ehll Tou, and there wasn't a thing I could say to sway him.

dialogue.name: ARVIDE
dialogue.text: Try as I might to distract him with work, somehow he managed to book us a trip across the Sea of Clouds. It's a wonder we caught up to you, all things considered... Just how long have you been waiting here?

dialogue.name: HAUTDLONG
dialogue.text: Where is she, MissSir Surname? Where's Ehll Tou?

dialogue.name: HAUTDLONG
dialogue.text: What? Why wouldn't she want to see us? That doesn't make any sense...

dialogue.name: HAUTDLONG
dialogue.text: Ehll Tou! Can you hear me!? Where are you!?

dialogue.name: EHLLTOU
dialogue.text: (-???-)Oh, shush! You'll wake something bigger than a dragonet with all that shouting.

dialogue.name: HAUTDLONG
dialogue.text: Huh!? That scarf... That hat... Wait... Ehll Tou, is that you!?

dialogue.name: EHLLTOU
dialogue.text:
Ah, I knew you would recognize me! Still, an explanation may be in order...
You see, a dragon's growth is dictated by forces both internal and external. Sometimes this growth can be quite...dramatic, as you can plainly see.

dialogue.name: EHLLTOU
dialogue.text: Truth be told, I had been feeling out of sorts lately, but now I see that that discomfort was merely the new me trying to break free. And now here she is─a dragon reborn!

dialogue.name: HAUTDLONG
dialogue.text: Oh, I'm so glad you're all right. More than all right, by the looks of things!

dialogue.name: EHLLTOU
dialogue.text: This new tool is wonderful! It's as if Master Arvide knew I was on the brink of incredible change!

dialogue.name: EHLLTOU
dialogue.text: Had I received this hammer but a day earlier, I would have held it clumsily in my tiny claws. Now, however, it feels like an extension of my very body. My mind is brimming with the possibilities of what I might craft next!

dialogue.name: DRAGONET03890
dialogue.text: Your growth is unlike aught I have seen before! Such a spectacular transformation has already made you the topic of much discussion among dragonkind, and I imagine not a small amount of jealousy.

dialogue.name: ARVIDE
dialogue.text: See, what did I tell you two? There was no need for all that fretting and fussing. Still, if not for young Hautdilong's concern, who knows if I would've ever set foot in the Churning Mists.

dialogue.name: EHLLTOU
dialogue.text: I apologize for causing undue worry, but I pray you understand how embarrassing it would've been if anyone saw me before I was ready. And now you are the first to behold a dragon not warped by conflict and strife, but nourished by peace and fellowship!

dialogue.name: EHLLTOU
dialogue.text: Well, not the first, surely. Only the first in quite some time. When man and dragon lived in harmony, maturation like mine may have been more common.

dialogue.name: HAUTDLONG
dialogue.text: I think there may be something to that, Ehll Tou. If we ask around, we may just find a dragon who has stories of those halcyon days. At the very least, it would be a chance to make new friends among the clouds!

dialogue.name: HAUTDLONG
dialogue.text: And we can start with our present company. I'd be eager to hear of your life here.

dialogue.name: DRAGONET03890
dialogue.text: Hmm? Me? Why, I would be delighted, although I have seen scarcely more summers than Ehll Tou.

dialogue.name: DRAGONET03890
dialogue.text: She has regaled me with many tales of the wingless ones that build and tinker. Far from the primitive brutes I had believed they were, her stories told of an inventive and adventurous people.

dialogue.name: DRAGONET03890
dialogue.text: While I thought the stories fanciful, I now see that if anything, they weren't fanciful enough!

dialogue.name: DRAGONET03890
dialogue.text: Mayhap I too shall journey down below the clouds and live among mankind for a time, and try my claws at this “crafting” of yours.

dialogue.name: HAUTDLONG
dialogue.text: You would be more than welcome!

dialogue.name: EHLLTOU
dialogue.text: Indeed! Is this not what we set out to accomplish from the onset? To bring man and dragon closer, one step at a time. I believe we are well on our way.

dialogue.name: DRAGONET03890
dialogue.text: I shall do my part by spreading the word far and wide! Surely, I'm not the only dragon interested in following Ehll Tou's path!

dialogue.name: EHLLTOU
dialogue.text: The more the merrier! I suppose we should return with haste and tell Lord Francel to expect a few more visitors to Ishgard. Even one so level-headed as he may be caught off guard by a sudden influx of dragons.

dialogue.name: HAUTDLONG
dialogue.text: Welcome back, MissSir Surname!

dialogue.name: ARVIDE
dialogue.text: I must confess, I had my doubts when I first agreed to this arrangement, but Ehll Tou and young Hautdilong here have proven more resourceful than I gave them credit for.

dialogue.name: EHLLTOU
dialogue.text: Of course, Surname deserves herhis share of the credit as well!

dialogue.name: EHLLTOU
dialogue.text: Were it not for your tutelage, I would not have grown as I have, and in doing so finally compel my friends to come mingle with the men and women of Ishgard!

dialogue.name: EHLLTOU
dialogue.text: Lord Francel was most understanding when we informed him of what we had planned. He gave his word to ensure that none of the less savory elements of the city would bring harm to its new visitors.

dialogue.name: EHLLTOU
dialogue.text: Even now he is working to inform those with authority in Ishgard to welcome my brothers and sisters!

dialogue.name: EHLLTOU
dialogue.text: Before long, the sight of wings in the sky will fill the hearts of men not with dread, but with elation!

dialogue.name: ARVIDE
dialogue.text: The industriousness of these two never fails to impress. We might do well to learn from them, eh?

dialogue.name: EHLLTOU
dialogue.text: I would also like to thank Hautdilong. Had he not come to the Churning Mists, the idea of befriending our erstwhile nemeses may have remained naught but an idle fancy for the other dragons. But thanks to his affable nature, the first spark of curiosity has been struck in their hearts.

dialogue.name: HAUTDLONG
dialogue.text: You are too kind, Ehll Tou! I, for one, can't wait to see this place alive with the sounds of dragon and man conversing in good faith.

dialogue.name: HAUTDLONG
dialogue.text: And with one endeavor having reached a satisfactory conclusion, I believe it may be time to begin another. My time spent with Ehll Tou has provided me with more than enough notes to begin my chronicles, but I must first compile and arrange them.

dialogue.name: ARVIDE
dialogue.text: Then you'd best begin sooner rather than later, lad. Once you're finished, bring it to the manufactory and I'll see about producing some illustrations to give your book a little flair.

dialogue.name: EHLLTOU
dialogue.text: Now isn't that a marvelous idea! You can fill the book with pictures so that even dragons who cannot read your letters can understand. Oh, what harmonious songs such a work could inspire!

dialogue.name: HAUTDLONG
dialogue.text: Songs, perhaps, that can be sung in unison! In fact, I believe I may have my title: “An Ode to Unity.” Man and dragon shall come to a deeper understanding─and I hope, appreciation─of the other by reading it.

dialogue.name: ARVIDE
dialogue.text: Not bad, lad. Not bad at all. Well then, it sounds to me that we've quite a lot of work ahead of us. I'd best get started.

dialogue.name: EHLLTOU
dialogue.text: Forename, might I trouble you to assist Master Hautdilong in the completion of his chronicle? I can think of nary a more ambitious work─this book may prove to be the very foundation for long-lasting peace.

dialogue.name: EHLLTOU
dialogue.text: For my part, I shall continue making deliveries to the Churning Mists, that my brothers and sisters there might be enticed to join their brethren here.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Future requests will be selected at random from all those you have seen thus far, with the list refreshed once a week (Earth time).

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You may review the items currently in demand at any time by speaking with Ehll Tou and selecting Make a delivery.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Note that printing essentials, printing materials, and inkshells will earn you particularly handsome rewards. Whenever they make an appearance, the effort to procure them will be worth your while.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: A new quest is available from Hautdilong in the New Nest.
